Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The northpike server is configured using a single XML-formatted configuration file. The format has a fully documented schema and so configuration files can be independently validated, and benefit from autocompletion in most modern IDEs.

The configuration file must consist of a single top-level Configuration element in the urn:com.io7m.northpike.server.configuration:1 namespace. In modern IDEs, simply creating a file containing this element will immediately fill in all the other required child elements.

Subsection.title: Description
Subsection.Paragraph: The AgentService section of the configuration file configures the main agent service.
The ListenAddress and ListenPort attributes specify the address and port to which to the service will bind. See the standard ports section for recommended port numbers.
The MaximumCommandSizeOctets attribute specifies the maximum size in octets of commands that will be accepted by the service.

The AgentService element must contain either a TLSEnabled or TLSDisabled element specifying whether TLS should be enabled or disabled, respectively. The TLSEnabled element describes the key store and trust store. The northpike server automatically reloads certificates periodically in order to work well in environments using the ACME protocol to issue certificates.

Subsection.title: Description
Subsection.Paragraph: The ArchiveService section of the configuration file configures the main archive service.
The ListenAddress and ListenPort attributes specify the address and port to which to the service will bind. See the standard ports section for recommended port numbers.
The AdvertiseURI attribute specifies the URI that should be used by external agents to download archives from the service.
The MaximumCommandSizeOctets attribute specifies the maximum size in octets of commands that will be accepted by the service.

The ArchiveService element must contain either a TLSEnabled or TLSDisabled element specifying whether TLS should be enabled or disabled, respectively. The TLSEnabled element describes the key store and trust store. The northpike server automatically reloads certificates periodically in order to work well in environments using the ACME protocol to issue certificates.

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The Database section of the configuration file configures the database.
The OwnerRoleName attribute specifies the name of the role that owns the database. Conventionally, this should be northpike_install, but can be set independently by the database administrator.
The OwnerRolePassword attribute specifies the password of the owner role.
The WorkerRolePassword attribute specifies the password of the worker role used for normal database operation.
The ReaderRolePassword attribute specifies the password of the reader role used for read-only database access. If this attribute is not specified, logging in using this role will be prevented.
The Name attribute specifies the database name.
The Create attribute specifies that the database schema should be created on startup.
The Upgrade attribute specifies that the database schema should be upgraded on startup.
The Language attribute specifies the language that will be used internally for full-text searching.

Subsection.title: Example
Subsection.Paragraph: An example database configuration:

FormalItem.title: Example
FormalItem.Verbatim: <Database Kind="POSTGRESQL" OwnerRoleName="northpike_install" OwnerRolePassword="mydatabase" WorkerRolePassword="willquickly" ReaderRolePassword="becompromised" Address="db.example.com" Port="5432" Name="northpike" Create="true" Upgrade="true" Language="english"/>

Subsection.title: Directories
Subsection.Paragraph: The Directories section of the configuration file configures the paths that will be used to store volatile data that, for whatever reason, cannot be stored in the database.
The RepositoryDirectory attribute specifies the base directory that will be used to store cloned repositories.
The ArchiveDirectory attribute specifies the base directory that will be used to store archives of commits to be downloaded by agents.

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The Idstore section of the configuration file configures the external idstore server.

Subsection.title: Description
Subsection.Paragraph: The BaseURI attribute specifies the base URI of the User API of the external idstore server. This server is used to authenticate users whenever they try to log in to the northpike server.
The PasswordResetURI attribute specifies the URI to which users should be redirected if they want to reset their passwords. This is the URI of the User View service on the external idstore server.

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The Maintenance section of the configuration file configures the maintenance service.

Subsection.title: TLSReloadInterval
Subsection.Paragraph: The TLSReloadInterval attribute specifies how frequently the server will reload the TLS certificates for the HTTP services; the server will reload certificates every time this interval elapses. The attribute must be formatted as an ISO 8601 duration string.

Subsection.title: ArchiveMaximumAge
Subsection.Paragraph: The ArchiveMaximumAge attribute specifies how frequently the maximum duration for which archives of commits will be stored; any archives older than this age will be deleted when the maintenance service executes.

Subsection.title: AgentLoginRecordsMaximumAge
Subsection.Paragraph: The AgentLoginRecordsMaximumAge attribute specifies how long records of agent login operations will be kept; any records that have existed for longer than this duration will be deleted when the maintenance service executes.

Subsection.title: AssignmentExecutionsMaximumAge
Subsection.Paragraph: The AssignmentExecutionsMaximumAge attribute specifies how long records of assignment executions will be kept; any execution records that have existed for longer than this duration will be deleted when the maintenance service executes.

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The OpenTelemetry section of the configuration file configures Open Telemetry. This section is optional and telemetry is disabled if the section is not present.
The logical service name should be provided in the LogicalServiceName attribute.

Subsection.title: Traces
Subsection.Paragraph: If the OpenTelemetry element contains a Traces element, OTLP traces will be sent to a specified endpoint. The Endpoint attribute specifies the endpoint, and the Protocol attribute can either be GRPC or HTTP.

Subsection.title: Metrics
Subsection.Paragraph: If the OpenTelemetry element contains a Metrics element, OTLP metrics will be sent to a specified endpoint. The Endpoint attribute specifies the endpoint, and the Protocol attribute can either be GRPC or HTTP.

Subsection.title: Logs
Subsection.Paragraph: If the OpenTelemetry element contains a Logs element, OTLP logs will be sent to a specified endpoint. The Endpoint attribute specifies the endpoint, and the Protocol attribute can either be GRPC or HTTP.

Subsection.title: Example
Subsection.Paragraph: An example Open Telemetry configuration:

FormalItem.title: Example
FormalItem.Verbatim: <OpenTelemetry LogicalServiceName="northpike01"> <Logs Endpoint="http://logs.example.com:4317" Protocol="GRPC"/> <Metrics Endpoint="http://metrics.example.com:4317" Protocol="GRPC"/> <Traces Endpoint="http://traces.example.com:4317" Protocol="GRPC"/> </OpenTelemetry>
